record.title: ORDER FOR RECESS AND ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, JANUARY 29, 2008
record.narrative:
ORDER FOR RECESS AND ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, JANUARY 29, 2008 -- (Senate - January 28, 2008)

[Page: S401]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, on behalf of the leader, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate stand in recess until 8:20 p.m., and that at 8:30 p.m., the Senate proceed as a body to the Hall of the House of Representatives to receive the President's State of the Union Address; that upon the dissolution of the joint session, the Senate adjourn until 10 a.m., Tuesday, January 29. I further ask that following the prayer and the pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved, and that there then be a period of morning business for up to 1 hour, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each, with the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees, with the Republican

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
